definition:
A quadratic number field $\mathbb{Q}(\sqrt{d})$, where $d$ is a negative
squarefree integer, is called a [*imaginary quadratic field*]{}.

The name may be thought to describe the fact that such a quadratic field
“imaginary numbers” (in the sense ‘non-real complex numbers’).

Other quadratic fields are [*real quadratic fields*]{}.
